an9.61:4.2: What is the progressive cessation that the Buddha spoke of?”
an9.61:5.1: “First, take a mendicant who, quite secluded from sensual pleasures …
an9.61:5.2: enters and remains in the first absorption.
an9.61:5.3: Thus far the Buddha spoke of progressive cessation in a qualified sense.
an9.61:6.1: Furthermore, take a mendicant who, going totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, enters and remains in the cessation of perception and feeling. And, having seen with wisdom, their defilements come to an end.
an9.61:6.2: Thus far the Buddha spoke of progressive cessation in a unqualified sense.”
